name: datasette
description: Datasette is an open source multi-tool for exploring and publishing data

subcommands.name: serve
subcommands.description: Serve up specified SQLite database files with a web UI

options.description: Database files to open in immutable mode
Host for server. Defaults to 127.0.0.1 which means only connections from the local machine will be allowed. Use 0.0.0.0 to listen to all IPs and allow access from other machines.
Port for server, defaults to 8001. Use -p 0 to automatically assign an available port. [0<=x<=65535]
Bind to a Unix domain socket
Automatically reload if code or metadata change detected - useful for development
Path to JSON file created using "datasette inspect"
Path to JSON/YAML file containing license/source metadata
Path to directory containing custom templates
Path to directory containing custom plugins
Serve static files from this directory at /MOUNT/...
Deprecated: set config option using configname:value. Use --setting instead.
Secret used for signing secure values, such as signed cookies
Output URL that sets a cookie authenticating the root user
Run an HTTP GET request against this path, print results and exit
Open Datasette in your web browser
Create database files if they do not exist
Enable cross-database joins using the /_memory database
Ignore locking, open locked files in readonly mode

subcommands.name: inspect
subcommands.description: Generate JSON summary of provided database files

subcommands.name: install
subcommands.description: Install plugins and packages from PyPI into the same...

subcommands.name: package
subcommands.description: Package SQLite files into a Datasette Docker container

options.description: Name for the resulting Docker container, can optionally use name:tag format
Path to JSON/YAML file containing metadata to publish
Extra options to pass to datasette serve
Install datasette from a GitHub branch e.g. main
Path to directory containing custom templates
Path to directory containing custom plugins
Serve static files from this directory at /MOUNT/...
Secret used for signing secure values, such as signed cookies
Port to run the server on, defaults to 8001 [1<=x<=65535]
Path to directory containing custom plugins

subcommands.name: publish
subcommands.description: Publish specified SQLite database files to the internet...

subcommands.name: cloudrun
subcommands.description: Publish databases to Datasette running on Cloud Run

options.description: Path to JSON/YAML file containing metadata to publish
Extra options to pass to datasette serve
Install datasette from a GitHub branch e.g. main
Path to directory containing custom templates
Path to directory containing custom plugins
Serve static files from this directory at /MOUNT/...
Secrets to pass to plugins, e.g. --pluginsecret datasette-auth-github client_id xxx
Secret used for signing secure values, such as signed cookies
Application name to use when building
Cloud Run service to deploy (or over-write)
Output the generated Dockerfile and metadata.json
Memory to allocate in Cloud Run, e.g. 1Gi
Number of vCPUs to allocate in Cloud Run

subcommands.name: heroku
subcommands.description: Publish databases to Datasette running on Heroku

options.description: Path to JSON/YAML file containing metadata to publish
Extra options to pass to datasette serve
Install datasette from a GitHub branch e.g. main
Path to directory containing custom templates
Path to directory containing custom plugins
Serve static files from this directory at /MOUNT/...
Secrets to pass to plugins, e.g. --pluginsecret datasette-auth-github client_id xxx
Secret used for signing secure values, such as signed cookies
Application name to use when deploying
--tar option to pass to Heroku, e.g.   --tar=/usr/local/bin/gtar
Output generated application files and stop without deploying
